title: Comparative Analysis and Application of Symbolic Learning Algorithms

context.prior_knowledge: Basic machine learning theory and statistical analysis knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners compare and analyze the performance of symbolic learning algorithms using real-case data, exploring methods for applying them to structural problem-solving. They freely utilize collaboration tools and analytical software in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain the operational principles of two symbolic learning algorithms (single-representation space vs. compositional induction)
Learners can quantitatively compare algorithm performance using various sampling methods, including 10-fold cross-validation
Learners can calculate and interpret error rates (total/omission/commission) by applying algorithms to real-world engineering design problems
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
